intro: Lahaya gnaphalioides, commonly known as the Mexican ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer, followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures. Lahaya gnaphalioides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
